description.zh-cn: 日本幕末至明治初期，主张以武力迫使朝鲜半岛开国的政治主张。
description.en: A political debate in Japan during the late Bakumatsu and early Meiji period regarding a punitive expedition to Korea.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的政治家，征韩论的主要倡导者之一，后来因明治六年政变下野。
description.en: A Japanese statesman during the Meiji Restoration, a key proponent of the Seikanron, who later resigned from the government during the Meiji Six Year Coup.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期的政治家，征韩论的支持者，明治六年政变后下野，成为自由民权运动的领袖。
description.en: A Japanese politician of the Meiji period, a supporter of Seikanron, who resigned after the Meiji Six Year Coup and became a leader of the Freedom and People's Rights Movement.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期的政治家，征韩论的支持者之一。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji period and a supporter of the Seikanron.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期的政治家，征韩论的支持者之一。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji period and a supporter of the Seikanron.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期的政治家，征韩论的支持者之一。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji period and a supporter of the Seikanron.

description.zh-cn: 1392年至1897年间统治朝鲜半岛的王朝，在征韩论时期采取锁国政策。
description.en: The dynasty that ruled the Korean Peninsula from 1392 to 1897, which adopted a policy of isolationism during the time of the Seikanron debate.

description.zh-cn: 19世纪末日本的一系列改革运动，导致了封建制度的终结和现代国家的建立。维新后武士的失业问题成为征韩论的背景之一。
description.en: A series of reforms in late 19th century Japan that ended the feudal system and established a modern state. The resulting unemployment of the samurai class was one of the background factors for the Seikanron.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治政府于1871年至1873年派遣至欧美各国的使节团。其归国成员反对立即征韩。
description.en: A Japanese diplomatic mission sent to the United States and Europe by the Meiji government between 1871 and 1873. Its returning members opposed an immediate invasion of Korea.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的政治家，岩仓使节团成员，归国后反对征韩论。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji Restoration and a member of the Iwakura Mission who opposed the Seikanron upon his return.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期的政治家，岩仓使节团的领导者，归国后反对征韩论。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji period and leader of the Iwakura Mission who opposed the Seikanron upon his return.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治维新时期的政治家，岩仓使节团成员，归国后反对征韩论。
description.en: A Japanese statesman of the Meiji Restoration and a member of the Iwakura Mission who opposed the Seikanron upon his return.

description.zh-cn: 1873年因征韩论争议引发的日本政府高层分裂事件，导致西乡隆盛、板垣退助等征韩派官员集体辞职。
description.en: A political upheaval in the Japanese government in 1873 over the Seikanron debate, leading to the mass resignation of pro-invasion officials like Saigō Takamori and Itagaki Taisuke.

description.zh-cn: 由不满明治政府的士族发动的叛乱，其起因与明治六年政变有关。
description.en: A rebellion by discontented samurai against the Meiji government, linked to the aftermath of the Meiji Six Year Coup.

description.zh-cn: 由西乡隆盛领导的反对明治政府的最后一次、也是规模最大的士族叛乱。
description.en: The final and largest samurai rebellion against the Meiji government, led by Saigō Takamori.

description.zh-cn: 日本明治时期的政治和社会运动，其起点与明治六年政变中下野的官员有关。
description.en: A political and social movement in Meiji Japan, whose origins are connected to the officials who resigned during the Meiji Six Year Coup.

description.zh-cn: 日本神话中神功皇后征服朝鲜半岛的传说，为“征韩论”一词的来源。
description.en: A legendary conquest of the Korean peninsula by Empress Jingū in Japanese mythology, which is the origin of the term 'Seikanron'.

description.zh-cn: 日本幕末时期的政治口号和运动，其关于日本对朝鲜半岛支配权的主张为征韩论提供了思想背景。
description.en: A political slogan and movement in late-Edo period Japan whose claims of Japanese sovereignty over the Korean peninsula provided an ideological background for the Seikanron.

description.zh-cn: 西乡隆盛是留守政府中主张以武力迫使朝鲜开国的主要领导者之一。
description.en: Saigō Takamori was one of the key leaders in the caretaker government who advocated for using military force to open Korea.

description.zh-cn: 板垣退助是留守政府中主张以武力迫使朝鲜开国的领导者之一。
description.en: Itagaki Taisuke was one of the leaders in the caretaker government who advocated for using military force to open Korea.

description.zh-cn: 江藤新平是留守政府中主张以武力迫使朝鲜开国的领导者之一。
description.en: Etō Shinpei was one of the leaders in the caretaker government who advocated for using military force to open Korea.

description.zh-cn: 后藤象二郎是留守政府中主张以武力迫使朝鲜开国的领导者之一。
description.en: Gotō Shōjirō was one of the leaders in the caretaker government who advocated for using military force to open Korea.

description.zh-cn: 副岛种臣是留守政府中主张以武力迫使朝鲜开国的领导者之一。
description.en: Soejima Taneomi was one of the leaders in the caretaker government who advocated for using military force to open Korea.

description.zh-cn: 征韩论背后的目的之一在于解决武士于明治维新后严重的失业问题。
description.en: One of the aims behind the Seikanron was to solve the serious unemployment problem of the samurai class after the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 李氏朝鲜因日本国书中有“大日本皇帝”字样而拒绝建交，其锁国政策激化了日本国内的“征韩论”。
description.en: The Joseon dynasty's refusal to establish diplomatic relations due to the term 'Emperor of Great Japan' in the Japanese state letter and its isolationist policy intensified the 'Seikanron' debate within Japan.

description.zh-cn: 1873年9月归国的岩仓使节团成员以时机尚早为由反对征韩，最终导致该计划被取消。
description.en: Members of the Iwakura Mission, upon their return in September 1873, opposed the expedition to Korea on the grounds that it was premature, ultimately leading to the cancellation of the plan.

description.zh-cn: 作为岩仓使节团的归国成员，大久保利通反对立即征韩。
description.en: As a returning member of the Iwakura Mission, Ōkubo Toshimichi opposed an immediate expedition to Korea.

description.zh-cn: 作为岩仓使节团的归国成员，岩仓具视反对立即征韩。
description.en: As a returning member of the Iwakura Mission, Iwakura Tomomi opposed an immediate expedition to Korea.

description.zh-cn: 作为岩仓使节团的归国成员，木户孝允反对立即征韩。
description.en: As a returning member of the Iwakura Mission, Kido Takayoshi opposed an immediate expedition to Korea.

description.zh-cn: 因征韩论争议引发的明治六年政变，导致西乡隆盛下野。
description.en: The Meiji Six Year Coup, sparked by the Seikanron controversy, led to the resignation of Saigō Takamori.

description.zh-cn: 因征韩论争议引发的明治六年政变，导致板垣退助下野。
description.en: The Meiji Six Year Coup, sparked by the Seikanron controversy, led to the resignation of Itagaki Taisuke.

description.zh-cn: 明治六年政变成为1874年佐贺之乱的起点。
description.en: The Meiji Six Year Coup became the starting point for the Saga Rebellion of 1874.

description.zh-cn: 明治六年政变成为1877年西南战争的起点。
description.en: The Meiji Six Year Coup became the starting point for the Satsuma Rebellion of 1877.

description.zh-cn: 明治六年政变成为自由民权运动的起点。
description.en: The Meiji Six Year Coup became the starting point for the Freedom and People's Rights Movement.

description.zh-cn: “征韩论”一词来源于日本神话中神功皇后的“三韩征伐”。
description.en: The term 'Seikanron' originates from the myth of Empress Jingū's 'Sankan seibatsu' (Conquest of the Three Hans).

description.zh-cn: 尊王攘夷运动中关于古代日本拥有朝鲜半岛支配权的政治主张，为征韩论提供了思想基础。
description.en: The political claims within the Sonnō jōi movement about ancient Japan's dominion over the Korean peninsula provided an ideological basis for the Seikanron.
